intro: Stachytarpheta candida f. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are usually violet or lilac in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
